xxl.core.binarySearchTrees
Class BinarySearchTree.LevelOrderIterator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.binarySearchTrees.BinarySearchTree.LevelOrderIterator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator
Enclosing class:
BinarySearchTree
public class BinarySearchTree.LevelOrderIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator

Inner class implementing level order traversal through the tree. During a level order traversal, nodes have to be stored in memory. This is done in a ListQueue internally. The queue can contain |leaf nodes| nodes at maximum.
Currently, the remove operation is not supported (throws an UnsupportedOperationExcetion).

Method Detail

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next or peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.). Implements java.util.Iterator.hasNext().

Specified by:

Returns:

                      throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the iteration.
The tree is not changed.
